25 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
26 // file: chuck_symbol.h
27 // desc: symbols in the syntax, adapted from Tiger compiler by Appel Appel
28 //
29 // author: Ge Wang (ge@ccrma.stanford.edu | gewang@cs.princeton.edu)
30 // adapted from: Andrew Appel (appel@cs.princeton.edu)
31 // date: Autumn 2002

33 #ifndef __CHUCK_SYMBOL_H__
34 #define __CHUCK_SYMBOL_H__
35 
36 //#include "chuck_utils.h"
37 
38 
39 #if defined(_cplusplus) || defined(__cplusplus)
40 extern "C" {
41 #endif
42 
43  typedef const char* c_constr;
44  typedef char* c_str;
45 
46  typedef struct S_Symbol_ * S_Symbol;
47 
48  /* Make a unique symbol from a given c_str.
49  * Different calls to make_symbol("foo") will yield the same S_Symbol
50  * value, even if the "foo" c_str are at different locations. */
51  S_Symbol insert_symbol( c_constr );
52 
53  /* Extract the underlying c_str from a symbol */
54  c_str S_name(S_Symbol);
55 
56 // Gwion spec
57  void free_Symbols();
58 
59 #ifdef __TABLE
60  /* S_table is a mapping from S_Symbol->any, where "any" is represented
61  * here by void* */
62  typedef struct TAB_table_ *S_table;
63 
64  /* Make a new table */
65  S_table S_empty(void);
66  S_table S_empty2(unsigned int size);
67 
68  /* Enter a binding "sym->value" into "t", shadowing but not deleting
69  * any previous binding of "sym". */
70  void S_enter(S_table t, S_Symbol sym, void * value);
71  void S_enter2(S_table t, c_constr str, void * value);
72 
73  /* Look up the most recent binding of "sym" in "t", or return NULL
74  * if sym is unbound. */
75  void * S_look(S_table t, S_Symbol sym);
76  void * S_look2(S_table t, c_constr str);
77 
78  /* Start a new "scope" in "t". Scopes are nested. */
79  void S_beginScope(S_table t);
80 
81  /* Remove any bindings entered since the current scope began,
82  and end the current scope. */
83  void S_endScope(S_table t);
84  void S_pop(S_table t);
85 #endif
86 
87 #if defined(_cplusplus) || defined(__cplusplus)
88 }
89 #endif

91 
92 
93 
94 #endif
